string.text: Flesh meat
Tough and bitter flesh meat is a frequently eaten meal in the Zone. Inexpensive, but most stalkers would prefer overpriced canned goods given the choice.
Boar chop
Much tougher to chew than their non-radioactive counterpart outside the Zone. Mutated boar chops will fetch a low but reasonable price.
Blind dog meat
Commonly harvested and traded in the Zone. Preferred over flesh meat because of its less bitter taste. Trades for a low but acceptable price.
Pseudodog meat
Harder to obtain than dog meat, but tastes almost exactly the same. Most stalkers won't pay a substantial amount because of this.
Bloodsucker meat
A stringy portion of bloodsucker meat. Despite the risks involved to kill one, it is often sold cheap because of its putrid taste.
Snork hand
The severed hand of a snork. Not drastically different from that of a person, but entirely grey, and covered in blisters and open wounds.
Fracture hand
A hand which once belonged to a fracture. Whilst thin and very boney, it also has extraordinary long and pointy fingers.
Zombie hand
A dirty and disgusting hand from a zombie. After losing all but their basic instincts, zombified stalkers resort to using their hands as weapons.
Chimera meat
A heavy slab of meat harvested from a chimera. Not many get the chance to feast upon such a horrifying beast, so naturally the meat is found sold at high prices.
Rodent meat
Whilst it comes in small portions there is also quite a large supply. As a result the meat is quite inexpensive, worth about the same as that from a blind dog.
Flesh eye
Completely different from those of the farm pigs they descended from, the eyeball of a flesh is heavy, large and entirely brown in colour.
Boar hoof
Boar hoofs are often worn by some stalkers around their necks as a good luck charm. Whilst others believe they have more 'exotic' uses when ground into a fine powder.
Dog tail
A long, hairless tail formerly attached to the rear of a blind dog. With no real practical use, they are the cheapest of all mutant body parts found in the Zone.
Psuedodog tail
The fur covering the tail of a pseudodog is a great insulator, and is often sewn into clothing and armoured suits when nearing the colder parts of the year.
Bloodsucker tentacles

Tentacles from a bloodsucker produce a ferment that can dissolve through even the toughest mutant hides whilst simultaneously preventing blood from clotting. Many researchers, including the Ecologists, believe that they hold many secrets to great medical advances.
Snork foot
Highly elasticated tendons found in the feet and legs of snorks give them the ability to make extraordinarily long leaps, much further than regular human beings.
Chimera tooth

A tooth extracted from the mouth of a chimera. Unusually, the chimera sheds and replaces is teeth throughout the entirety of its lifetime, meaning most that are found usually broken or worn, and not very valuable.
Chimera claw

Whilst able to tear through several sheets of Kevlar without struggle, they are often worn down through such extreme use, and much like their teeth, are shed and replaced frequently making them an inexpensive commodity.
Tushkano head
The eyes, ears, mouth and nose of a tushkano in a small, tiny package. Not very useful, nor very valuable.
Controller brain

The brains of controllers are highly developed, able to take over the minds of other beings. For this very reason they are highly sought after by the Ecologists and can be sold for much more than most other mutant parts.
Controller hand

A controller's hands are believed to assist its brain with some of its mental abilities, such as directing psychic bolt attacks. As such, they are highly sought after by the Ecologists, who value them equally as important as the controller's brain.
Cat tail

Cats in the Zone are believe to have evolved from local population of wild Lynx. Theirs tails are carried by stalkers as a symbol of awareness, giving them at least some value unlike those of their canine counterparts.
Pseudogiant hand

A large, muscled hand from a pseudogiant which are ironically one of the smallest body parts of the creature. Not very useful but hard to obtain, so they can still get a good price if sold to the right buyer.
Pseudogiant eye

A large, grotesque eyeball formerly belonging to a pseudogiant. It is interesting to note that a pseudogiant's eyeballs are usually two different sizes. While not particularly interesting, they can usually sell for a good price.
Burer hand

The hands of a burer are directly linked to their psychic abilities, able to move objects, shield themselves and cause shock-waves from a distance. Naturally they are of particular interest to the Ecologists, and are very valuable.
Karlik ear

A pointy ear from a karlik. About the only scientifically interesting body part, as the majority of the brain and its cells are destroyed by a release of chemicals upon death. Very valuable due to the luck and skill required to obtain them.
Crow beak

Somehow the Zone's crows are the only creatures not to have undergone drastic mutations. As such, researchers are interested in any body parts that can be retrieved, believing they have a strong immunity to the effects of radiation.
